author.bio: god, what a bad run this site was.
author.bio_html: god, what a bad run this site was.

body:
Ingestion of fluoride isn't safe past 4 ppm, and in the us they put different fluoride compounds in your water which equates to 1 ppm, so that's not healthy, especially if you drink more water than the average person- duh.  but other things have fluoride as well, which include- but are not limited to: fish, eggs, tea and meat. But that's ingestion. I'm sure you're not against applying it to your teeth? it gets absorbed into your teeth, hardening the enamel and helps protect them from acid attacks which occurs after meals. But yes, too much can cause health issues like flourosis. Then again, too much of anything is bad for you- even oxygen!

I've studied what GMOs are and their effects and what can be done, had lessons with a GMO researcher. GMOs are constantly under the microscope, and soon as they're found to cause a negative side effect like allergies, they're taken off the shelf. But guess what, none has. Especially because if something doesnt work out in the lab, the development is stopped (they look for a resemblance between the "protein sequences known to be allergenic and the trait they are considering, if there is one, they stop the development of the GMO"). They dont cause allergies any more than non-altered food does, in fact, scientists are trying to disable the protein in peanuts that triggers allergies in people who have a peanut allergy. As of now, someone who's allergic to soy will be allergic to both the altered and non-altered versions. They even do skin tests on (volonteered) people with allergies to see if it works.

If you're afraid of the fact that GMOs have DNA, (as many sadly are), then you'll be happy to know that all plants and meat you're already eating have DNA.

Fun fact, 90% of allergens in food in the USA are caused by only eight foods: peanuts, tree nuts, milk, eggs, wheat, soy, shellfish and fish. However, soy is the only one commercially available in genetically modified varieties.

*Dunning-Kruger effect*. people who know less about GMOs are more likely to be against them ;)

Fun fact, 90% of allergens in food in the USA are caused by only eight foods: peanuts, tree nuts, milk, eggs, wheat, soy, shellfish and fish. However, soy is the only one commercially available in genetically modified varieties.
